api/Plugin_InstalledApps.InstalledApps.h.keywords: Class InstalledApps Namespace Plugin_InstalledApps Assembly Plugin_InstalledApps.dll Interaction logic for plugin public class InstalledApps : IPlugger Inheritance object InstalledApps Implements IPlugger Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors InstalledApps() public InstalledApps() Properties ListOfSystemApps public static List<ListItem> ListOfSystemApps { get; } Property Value List<ListItem> PluggerName This is name will display in main plug board public string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string PluginSettings public static Settings PluginSettings { get; set; } Property Value Settings Methods OnAppShutdown() This method will run just before the application shuts down, i.e., when the user clicks 'exit' in the tray task context menu. Useful for any clean-up required. public void OnAppShutdown() OnAppStartup() This method will run just after the application starts up, e.g., when the user runs Quokka.exe. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnSearchWindowStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. public void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) public List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string Returns List<ListItem> OnSearchWindowStartup() This method will run just after the search window starts up. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnAppStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. public void OnSearchWindowStartup() OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. public List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The command the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the command. These will be displayed in the search windows results list RemoveBlacklistItems(List<ListItem>) public static List<ListItem> RemoveBlacklistItems(List<ListItem> list) Parameters list List<ListItem> Returns List<ListItem> SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. public List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The special commands; the commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins.

api/Quokka.PluginArch.IPlugger.html.title: Interface IPlugger | QuokkaDocs
api/Quokka.PluginArch.IPlugger.html.keywords: Interface IPlugger Namespace Quokka.PluginArch Assembly Quokka.dll All plugins must implement this interface. public interface IPlugger Properties PluggerName The name of the plugin string PluggerName { get; set; } Property Value string Methods OnAppShutdown() This method will run just before the application shuts down, i.e., when the user clicks 'exit' in the tray task context menu. Useful for any clean-up required. void OnAppShutdown() OnAppStartup() This method will run just after the application starts up, e.g., when the user runs Quokka.exe. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnSearchWindowStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. void OnAppStartup() OnQueryChange(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window. Used to give the user the results they want to see from their query. List<ListItem> OnQueryChange(string query) Parameters query string The user's current query Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the user's query. These will be displayed in the search windows results list OnSearchWindowStartup() This method will run just after the search window starts up. Useful for any required resource gathering within the appropriate time context; there is a OnAppStartup() method which may be more appropriate for certain tasks. void OnSearchWindowStartup() OnSpecialCommand(string) Runs when the user changes their query in the search window to one of the commands provided by SpecialCommands(). Used to give the user the results they want to see from the command. List<ListItem> OnSpecialCommand(string command) Parameters command string The command the user has entered Returns List<ListItem> A List of ListItems appropriate for the command. These will be displayed in the search windows results list SpecialCommands() Used to define special commands that should have unique results. When one of these commands is entered by the user, OnSpecialCommand(string command) is called. ListItems from other plugins will not appear when one of these commands is entered. The commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins. List<string> SpecialCommands() Returns List<string> The special commands; the commands defined should be unique as to NOT CLASH with other plugins.
